description: Functions to interact with a `duckdb_config`, which is the configuration parameter for opening a database.

comment.description:
Initializes an empty configuration object that can be used to provide start-up options for the DuckDB instance
through `duckdb_open_ext`.
The duckdb_config must be destroyed using 'duckdb_destroy_config'

This will always succeed unless there is a malloc failure.

Note that `duckdb_destroy_config` should always be called on the resulting config, even if the function returns
`DuckDBError`.

This returns the total amount of configuration options available for usage with `duckdb_get_config_flag`.

This should not be called in a loop as it internally loops over all the options.
comment.return_value: The amount of config options available.

comment.description:
Obtains a human-readable name and description of a specific configuration option. This can be used to e.g.
display configuration options. This will succeed unless `index` is out of range (i.e. `>= duckdb_config_count`).

The result name or description MUST NOT be freed.

param_comments.index: The index of the configuration option (between 0 and `duckdb_config_count`)
param_comments.out_name: A name of the configuration flag.
param_comments.out_description: A description of the configuration flag.

comment.description:
Sets the specified option for the specified configuration. The configuration option is indicated by name.
To obtain a list of config options, see `duckdb_get_config_flag`.

In the source code, configuration options are defined in `config.cpp`.

This can fail if either the name is invalid, or if the value provided for the option is invalid.

param_comments.config: The configuration object to set the option on.
param_comments.name: The name of the configuration flag to set.
param_comments.option: The value to set the configuration flag to.

comment.description: Destroys the specified configuration object and de-allocates all memory allocated for the object.
